13 Calon Hakim Agung Lolos Tahap Seleksi Kesehatan dan Kepribadian
05 Nov 2019, 19:58 by Suhanda


13 Calon Hakim Agung Lolos Tahap Seleksi Kesehatan dan Kepribadian

KBRN Jakarta :  Komisi Yudisial  mengumumkan 13 orang calon hakim agung yang berhasil lolos di tahap III, yakni seleksi kesehatan dan kepribadian. Menurut Ketua Bidang Rekrutmen Hakim Komisi Yudisial, Aidul Fitriciada Azhari, penetapan kelulusan tersebut ditetapkan dalam Rapat Pleno KY Calon Hakim Agung Tahun 2019, dan calon yang lolos akan mengikuti seleksi wawancara."Selanjutnya para calon hakim agung tersebut akan mengikuti seleksi wawancara pada Selasa-Kamis, 12-14 November 2019 di Gedung KY, Jakarta. Dalam wawancara ini Calon Hakim Agung akan digali lebih mendalam mengenai visi, misi, dan komitmen, Kode Etik dan Pedoman Perilaku Hakim (KEPPH), filsafat hukum dan teori hukum, wawasan pengetahuan peradilan dan perkembangan hukum, serta penguasaan hukum materil dan formil, " ungkapnya pada wartawan di Gedung Komisi Yudisial Jl. Kramat Raya No.57, Jakarta Pusat, Dijelaskannya, dari 13 calon hakim agung tersebut berasal dari jalur karier sebanyak 12 orang dan jalur non karier sebanyak 1 orang. yang  diperuntukan bagi hakim agung  kamar agama Perdata pidana Militer dan kamar tata usaha negara khususnya pajak.Dikatakan Aidul Fitriciada Azhari Hakim agung yang lolos berasal dari berbagai profesi dan pendidikan. “Bberdasarkan kategori jenis kelamin, sebanyak 11 orang calon merupakan laki-laki, dan hanya 2 orang perempuan. Dilihat dari profesi calon hakim agung yang lulus seleksi kesehatan dan kepribadian, 10 orang berprofesi hakim, 1 orang berprofesi akademisi, dan 2 orang berprofesi hakim pajak. Berdasarkan kategori pendidikan, sebanyak 7 orang bergelar doktor dan 6 orang lainnya bergelar magister,” pungkasnya.Komisi Yudisial melakukan seleksi Calon Hakim Agung ini untuk mengisi 8 orang hakim agung dengan rincian, 3 orang untuk kamar Pidana, 1 orang untuk kamar Agama, 2 orang untuk kamar Militer, 4 orang untuk kamar Perdata, dan 1 orang untuk kamar Tata Usaha Negara khusus pajak.

13 Prospective Chief Justice Passes Stage of Health and Personality Selection
05 Nov 2019, 19:58 by Suhanda


13 Prospective Chief Justice Passes Stage of Health and Personality Selection

KBRN Jakarta: The Judicial Commission announced 13 prospective judges who had successfully passed stage III, namely health and personality selection. According to the Judicial Commission Chief Recruitment Chairman, Aidul Fitriciada Azhari, the determination of the graduation was determined at the KY Supreme Court Candidate for the 2019 Supreme Court Candidates, and the candidates who passed will take part in the interview selection. " November 12-14, 2019 in KY Building, Jakarta In this interview, the prospective Supreme Court Justices will be explored in more depth about their vision, mission and commitment, the Code of Ethics and the Code of Conduct for Judges (KEPPH), legal philosophy and legal theory, insight into judicial knowledge and legal developments, as well as mastery of material and formal law, "he told reporters at the Judicial Commission Building Jl. Kramat Raya No.57, Central Jakarta, He explained, from the 13 prospective justices came from the career path of 12 people and the non-career path of 1 person. intended for the Chief Justice of the Religious Civil Code, the Military Criminal Chamber and the State Administrative Chamber, especially Tax. Said Aidul Fitriciada Azhari The Chief Justice who escaped came from various professions and education. "Based on the sex category, as many as 11 candidates are male, and only 2 women. Judging from the profession of prospective justices who passed the health and personality selection, 10 people were judges, 1 was academic, and 2 were tax judges. Based on the education category, as many as 7 people hold doctorates and 6 others hold masters degrees, "he concluded. The Judicial Commission selected the prospective Supreme Court Justices to fill 8 Supreme Court justices with details, 3 people for Criminal rooms, 1 person for Religious rooms, 2 people for Religious rooms, 2 people for the Military room, 4 people for the Civil room, and 1 person for the State Administration special tax room.
